question.questionText: Sometimes a red stoplight changes to green only when a car stops at the light. A type of magnet hidden under the surface of the road triggers the light to turn green. What is it about the car that could trigger a magnet to send a signal to the light?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: A car is made of a lot of iron or steel.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The car is made of iron or steel.
Cars have iron or steel in them so they might attract to the magnets.
If the car stops and waits a little while then the stoplight changes on the other side so the car can go.
It is iron or steel.
It stop the magnet.
It might hit the electricity to make it work.
The car is made of iron and steel and magnets only stick to iron or steel. So when the car stops it triggers the stoplight.
Cars are made of steel and steel is attracted to magnetism.
The car has iron or steel on it so the magnet sends a signal.
It triggers because the car is made of steel.
If the car goes over the magnet faster than 5 miles per hour it should turn green.
The car could be made of iron.
The metal of the tire rim or under the car or the outside of the car except the windows. Only if the metal has iron.

So the cars can go.
It does that because the magnet in the light attracts to the iron on the car.
The car is made out of iron so they can attract.

It does that because the magnet in the light attracts to the iron on the car.
